alert.note: Alert for Garden; Grant; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 10:32PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Grant, northern Garden and southern Sheridan Counties through 1030 PM MDT... At 932 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Ellsworth to 7 miles north of Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge to 15 miles north of Lisco. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Antioch, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Watson Lake, Rackett, Patterson Lake, Finnegan Lake, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Kincaid Lake, Kennedy Lake, Wild Horse Flats, Miles Lake, Snow Lake, Richardson Lake, Mumper, Bingham, Wickson Lake, Lakeside and Herman Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 11. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of and west central Nebraska.
